dimensions.description: Assesses whether the review communicates a clear overall judgment (e.g., positive/negative/mixed) and supports it with specific, relevant reasons rather than vague assertions.
Evaluates how well the text addresses important elements such as plot, acting, action/choreography, direction/production quality, pacing, and originality in a balanced way.
Measures logical flow and readability, including whether points are structured sensibly, transitions are clear, and the review avoids rambling or contradictory statements.
Rates grammar, spelling, punctuation, and sentence construction, including appropriate formatting (e.g., avoiding excessive typos or distracting markup) that affects comprehension.
Judges whether the tone is suitable for a review (not overly hostile, biased, or ad hominem) and whether criticisms/praise are proportionate and respectful.
